net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color

Class Lightness

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<V>
        • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractSimpleDatatype<V>
          • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.AbstractSegment<Double>
            • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.AbstractDoubleSegment<SELF>
              • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.Factor<Lightness>
                • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.Lightness
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Segment<Double>, AttributeReadMaximumValue<Double>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<Double>, AttributeReadValue<Double>, Datatype, SimpleDatatype<Double>

    public class Lightness
extends Factor<Lightness>
    This Segment represents the lightness of a Color. Just like Brightness it is a factor indicating the amount of light emitted by a Color, but relative to the Brightness of a similarly illuminated white.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    GenericColor.getLightness(), Serialized Form

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Segment<Double>
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractSimpleDatatypeBase<Double>
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.
